question: I have 2 large cysts, one 15 cm in my abdomen, one 11 cm on my right ovary.  I am 50 years old and post menaposal.  I have been told I have to have surgery and am wanting to know about other alternatives.  Why can't they drain them?  I had a CA125 test and it was a 12.  I was told 35 and above is a sign of cancer.  They want to do robotic surgery on me.  I have diabetes, SVT, mitral valve prolapse and high blood pressure.  All in all I am a poor surgery risk.
title: Women's health
